info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 05 at 4:08AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG EARLY THIS MORNING... Patchy to areas of fog will continue to develop across parts of south coastal South Carolina and into the Savannah Metro Area this morning. The fog could become locally dense at time with visibilities dropping to 1/4 mile or less, mainly near the coast and up along Charleston Harbor, the Broad River and the Savannah River. The nature of the fog is such that visibilities will vary greatly over short distances with the risk for locally dense fog being the greatest near bodies of water and other low- lying areas such as marshes, swamps and large ditches. Motorists should remain alert for these conditions this morning. Some locations that could see locally dense fog include Isle of Palms, Mount Pleasant, Downtown Charleston, Daniel Island, Johns Island, Edisto Island, Beaufort, Hilton Head, Tybee Island, Wilmington Island, Skidaway Island and parts of the Savannah Metro Area.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down and leave extra distance ahead of you in case a sudden stop is needed.
